post_text:
For Immediate Release:

Todd Stewart selected as new Superintendent of Schools

The Ashburnham-Westminster Regional School Committee is pleased to announce the appointment of Mr. Todd Stewart to the post of Superintendent of Schools. At Monday's school committee meeting, he was the committee's unanimous choice to lead the district.

Prior to his arrival, he has been a Superintendent Fellow in the Worcester Public Schools and Principal and Assistant Principal in the Wachusett Regional School District and Quabbin Regional School District.

Todd’s passion for education has lead him to devote his entire professional life to serving the young people in schools in Massachusetts, and he has a deep understanding of and appreciation for the strengths, traditions, and unique challenges present in our region of the state and our school district.

Ashburnham Westminster Regional School District Receives
Safer Schools and Communities Grant

[Ashburnham, Massachusetts, July 12, 2019] The Ashburnham-Westminster Regional School District is pleased to announce that Overlook Middle School has received a Safer Schools and Communities “Local Equipment and Technology” grant from the Executive Office of School Safety and Security for $59,604.93.

This grant will assist the school district in completing the second phase of its security plan by funding the installation of cameras, mounts and cabling in the hallways and common spaces in Overlook Middle School. The district has consulted with the Ashburnham and Westminster Police Departments and Valley Communications in the design of this project.

For more information, please contact:
Eric DeHays, Director of Technology and Communications
